screen.title: Code hosting

summary.p: Bazaar version control lets anyone create their own branch of your project's code.
Launchpad helps you keep track of all the branches of your code. It can even continuously import most CVS and Subversion repositories, giving you a Bazaar branch of the code.
First, you need to tell Launchpad about your code.

screen.callout: If your code is already in a Bazaar branch, simply give Launchpad its URL and a short summary.

You can use Bazaar to access code stored in Subversion and CVS repositories by requesting that Launchpad make the code available in Bazaar. Launchpad will regularly update the Bazaar branch from the original repository.

screen.title: Browsing branches
screen.summary: Browsing all the branches associated with your project is easy. Launchpad catalogues each branch, including its full revision history, and displays major project branches alongside those created by individuals.
screen.callout: Both teams and individuals can register their branches of your code, helping you to find all lines of development associated with your project.
Launchpad Code Hosting integrates with Launchpad's other applications. If a branch fixes a bug or implements a blueprint, Launchpad links the two.
Each branch's owner can set the status of their branch. This status and the branch description help new developers choose which line of development to branch.
screen.transition: Let's take a look at one of the branches in detail.

screen.title: Branch detail
screen.summary: Launchpad shows you the detail of each branch it knows about.
screen.callout: The branch owner's image appears beside the branch name, in the top-left corner of the page. This makes it easy to identify the individual or team responsible for the branch.
Launchpad shows you where the branch is hosted, making it easy to retrieve the code.
Launchpad shows you the latest activity in this branch by displaying the most recent developer commit messages.
For more detail, you can browse the code itself, with diffs and a complete revision history.
